snippet: Gen. John R. Allen has submitted military options to the Pentagon that would keep 6,000 to 20,000 American troops in Afghanistan after the NATO mission ends in 2014.
abstract: Gen John R Allen, senior American commander in Afghanistan, has submitted military options to the Pentagon that would keep 6,000 to 20,000 American troops in Afghanistan after NATO mission ends in 2014.

byline.original: By ELISABETH BUMILLER and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: Gen. John R. Allen has submitted military options to the Pentagon that would keep 6,000 to 20,000 American troops in Afghanistan after the NATO mission ends in 2014.

headline.seo: Afghan War Commander Gives Options for After 2014
headline.main: Afghan War Commander Gives Options for After ’14
headline.print_headline: Afghan War Commander Gives Options For After ’14
